Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Stuartandtrudy
Reviews.Content: Central location. Excellent hosts who who went out of their way to provide information about the best attractions and eating places. They genuinely care that you enjoy your holiday. Friendly, clean and good value in our opinion. We guess the decor not to everyone's tastes but suited ours! A refreshing change to the standard one usually experiences in big cities

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: hannah b
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect honeymoon at Pensione Barrett!!! Michele and Cinzia and all the staff were extremely welcoming and helpful throughout the whole of our stay - offering us advice about sights / restaurants and things to do. The room was totally unique, comfortable and very well stocked with food, drinks and all things necessary for days out in Rome. The hotel is perfectly positioned for walking to all the must see sights of Rome and is also on the edge of the lovely jewish quarter with loads of great restaurants! The only place to stay in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, terrific owners”
Reviews.Author: mittim
Reviews.Content: It appears everyone's said all the good things about this pensione and its owners, Michele and Cinzia, who are most welcoming, most knowledgeable and most kind. Location is superb, centrally sited for walking, taking buses or trams. The place had been recommended by an Italian friend who stays there when in Rome. It worked out perfectly for our stay! The website alone is worth checking out. Dean Martin meets Mr. Bean meets Mickey Mouse.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: Mad-about-travellin
Reviews.Content: Michele and Cinzia, the hotel owners, are amazing! During our stay, they treated us in five class style. They gave us various tips on what to eat and where, they were extremely helpful, kind and polite. We found our stay very pleasant. The hotel is a small boutique hotel right in the centre of the old part of Rome, 5 min away from the major highlights like pantheon, piazza navona, piazza venezia, campo di fiori. Moreover it is served very well by buses & trams. The hotel is so beautiful, very artistic, cosy and comfy. There was a fantastic massage chair & foot massager in our room. Also facilities for coffee (coffee machine) & a small oven & a fully stocked fridge! Our room was kept very clean. What else could we ask for?? If I return to Rome, this is the place where I'll stay. Grazzie Michele e Cinzia e auguri da Malta!! Veronique e Maria :) :)

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay to get anywhere in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ecudchi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barrett for four nights in early March with my wife and another couple. I chose this hotel based on the reviews here and could not have been happier with my choice! Michelle and his wife were excellent hosts. When we arrived we were shown to our rooms and told how everything worked. After that we sat down with Michelle and he explained all of the must see's in the city. He also took our map and gave us a walking guide to the city! We could not have asked for better hosts! As for the hotel, the room was very nice. We had one on the inner courtyard so noise was not an issue at all. We did have trouble initially finding the hotel because it is located on the second floor of a building, and the bus station kind of blocks the sign. That was the only negative, and that wasn't that big of a deal. The location was great we could literally walk to everything, 10 minutes to the Collesium, 20 minutes to St Peters, 15 minutes to the trevi fountain, and if you needed the bus station was right outside of your hotel to go anywhere you wanted to go. Overall I give this hotel 5 stars! It was a great experience, and I will definately stay here again if for nothing else the lovely couple who run this hotel and made us feel at home. Thanks for a great stay Barrett!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “a great experience”
Reviews.Author: rami y
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Barrett Rome five nights on march 2012 . It is located in an ideal place enables you arriving at the most sites in Rome by walking . The couple who own the hotel and it's staff are very polite and do the maximum in order to provide all your needs . We realy felt there like in our own home .

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, fantastic owners”
Reviews.Author: Bazerino
Reviews.Content: A fantastic location-you can walk to anywhere in Rome from this funky hotel.Cinzia, Michele and the staff were so helpful. We were provided with guide books, map and lists of places to visit or eat. The bedrooms are unbelievable! Everyone is decorated differently- an experience in itself- with massaging chair, foot massager, Jacuzzi shower and an electric footbath too. An amazing place-I would definately go again. Loved the ruins right in front of the hotel- and visited the cat sanctuary in there!

Reviews.Title: “Great pension!”
Reviews.Author: Chaper001
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our experience at Pensione Barrett. Perfect location in Campo Dei Fiori with access to most of the attraction at a walking distance. Friendly and very helpful staff and owners. The decoration in the room is definitively kitsch but they are well equipped and very clean. The owners will direct you to lesser known sites in Rome and will provide very good trattoria recommendations (ask for the list!). I would definitively recommend to stay at this Pensione.

Reviews.Title: “A true highlight”
Reviews.Author: Vivien P
Reviews.Content: Last year I was taken to Rome for my birthday by one of my daughters and she booked us into Pensione Barrett. I was just thinking about how fab Rome is and felt compelled to sit down and write a review about this wonderful place where we stayed. It is in a terrific location and the couple who own it could not be better people. The sort of people that only add joy to ones life. I cannot wait to return to both Rome and the Pensione Barrett - I wouldn't wish to stay anywhere else in the city! I do quite a lot of solo travelling and would happily stay here if travelling alone and there are not many places where I have stayed that I can say that of.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pensione”
Reviews.Author: JacobBryce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pensione Barrett over two stays for a total of 10 nights in January 2012. The rooms (while small) are magnificent; they seem to try to compete with all of the baroque palaces and museums of Rome in their classical design and ornamentation. The owners and staff went above and beyond the service which might be expected. No special request was too much trouble for them. For example:- * Michele, the owner, happily spent hours with us giving us detailed itineraries and notes to plan our trips to the various sites. * They arranged pre-paid tickets to the tourist sites. * Although the Pensione officially has no room service, we requested tea in our rooms. The staff were happy to oblige, bringing us tea twice daily, whenever we came back into our room. * They were happy to look after some of our luggage in between our two stays while we left to visit another part of Italy. * On our request they stored in their refrigerator all our various purchases of salamis and cheeses to take back home; (we bought more than we could fit in our bar-fridge). * Upon our request they were happy to switch us to a different room. They were always happy and friendly and delighted to be of service. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MrsF0z
Reviews.Content: If you're the type who would rather stay at boutique hotels rather than 5 star hotels- then this is the hotel for you! Perfect location, decent rooms, great staff and just a wonderful place to stay altogether!

Reviews.Title: “Eccentrically Central”
Reviews.Author: ladybue
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at this hotel. Perfect location with access to everything. Friendly and helpful staff and owners. The rooms are fantastically decorated - we counted 28 putti, ten graces and 8 columns in our room, not to mention massage chair and foot spa. The owners will direct you to lesser known sites in Rome, and their restaurant recommendations were good. This time I travelled with a friend, but would be happy to stay there on my own, as the welcome was so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bravissimi!”
Reviews.Author: vikadikad
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights beginning 1/1/2012. This place was lavishly decorated with Roman artifacts, pictures, ornaments, even a fountain in the lobby area. The rooms were immaculate and comfortable. Location was superb. Even though it was very close to most of the important tourist sites, there was a neighborly feel to it. You could see Italians go about their daily lives. Michele and Cinzia, the married couple owners, were attentive and extremely helpful. Michele knows a lot of Roman history and can help you with planning your visits to important sites. I always appreciate a place for it's location and cleanliness but I also put a lot of value in the people who run the place. In this respect I think Michele and Cinzia were bravissimi!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and good value!”
Reviews.Author: mitochi
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Pensione Barrett since many years. One could regard the rooms as too small and overloaded with statues and paintings, but actually these are very tiny details. The place is very well managed. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic you will not find another place close to the Centro Storico and having the same level of service. I have tried out many hotels since I studied in Rome in 2005 and have always come back to Pensione Barrett!

Reviews.Title: “lovely!”
Reviews.Author: KlaraWww
Reviews.Content: We came for 5 days to see Rome and also "live Rome" if you know what I mean. The place is extremely well located, super-clean and has everything we could have wanted. We heard no noise from the other rooms, which we absolultey hate. >They have the most wonderful and relaxed staff and the couple who runs it is absolutely adorable. We felt at home, private and well taken care of. I want to go back now that I wrote this review..

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: MargaretS301
Reviews.Content: The owners of the Pensione Barrett, Michele and Cinzia, are clearly dedicated to making their guests’ stay as enjoyable as possible. It's apparent that the pensione is more than a family business to them; it’s their life’s passion. I did a lot of research on restaurants and sightseeing routes and schedules before taking my daughter on our 9-day trip to Rome, where I had lived for four years a few decades ago. The owners and the night concierge, however, gave us masses of extraordinarily helpful information beyond what I already knew. When we returned after our first day with aching muscles from all the walking on cobblestones, they made sure we used the back massager and foot massager in our room. What a difference that made. We used the massagers every day after that. Michele and Cinzia pointed out that there was a lot of thought behind everything they did. It was obvious to us that this was true. We’re late sleepers, so we appreciated the blackout shutters that kept our room dark. The abundant breakfast items and beverages in the room were a bargain and provided the convenience of food and drinks available to use at any time, night or day. Regarding the fun and startling décor that leaves no space unadorned, Michele told us that “irony is important.” One of the things I now miss most about Rome is the Pensione Barrett.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet perfect central”
Reviews.Author: Wallywallbanger
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Excellent service. Clean overly decorated room. Very quiet. Ok beds. No breakfast but very good espresso machine in the room. Very recommendable but dont expect a lot of space.

Reviews.Title: “nice and cosy”
Reviews.Author: goran_wiklander
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barrett is conviently located in the Centro Storico, a few blocks away from Campo dei Fiore and Piazza Navonna. Looking out the window, you see a whole block of ancient Roman temples, actually the oldest one from the republican era. The hotel interior is furnished in the style of Art and Antiquity. The hotel staff is delighted to inform you of the gems of ancient Rome. Thus a very litterary hotel for the cultural traveller. Cosy and nice. The only drawback i there is no elevator and no breakfast room, although there are breakfast facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MandSBoston
Reviews.Content: All the previous reviews of Pensione Barrett are right on. This B&B is perfectly located, the staff is extremely helpful, and the room was a good size and very quiet. Every piece of advice provided by the staff was perfect whether it was a restaurant recommendation or helping us avoid the line at the primary sites during a holiday weekend. We would definitely not look any further for a hotel or B&B the next time we are in Rome, and would recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful staff ever...”
Reviews.Author: Quinnynews
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed four nights. The location is superb. Everything is walking distance but if you don't like to traverse the cobbles then buses and trams are in abundance. The room is compact but comfortable with all the amenities you will need. What makes Pensione Barrett really stand out is the amazing owners and staff. I have travelled extensively throughout the world and have never encountered the level of genuine care and attention given by the staff in this hotel to its guests. Nothing is too much trouble and the recommendations you will receive on where to visit, where to eat and how to avoid the queues will ensure you have a delightful stay in this magnificent city. Pensione Barrett is not for those who like corporate faceless hotels, but it will be perfect for those who like local charm, decor and staff who enjoy seeing and contributing to your enjoyment of their beautiful city and their homely and happy hotel. I can only hope I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Di S
Reviews.Content: This place is just fantastic. They have made a real effort with the decor, it's interesting and busy and they move things about every day which was pretty novel (only in the lounges not in our room). The rooms are small but have absolutely everything you could want from foot massagers to coffe machines and a fridge crammed full of very reasonably priced food and drink. The owners and all the staff are so helpfull; we borrowed books, got directions to great little restaurants, they told us what buses to catch how to use the tram; they couldn't have done more. The pensione is ideally placed for sightseeing and we walked almost everywhere, catching a bus only on the last day as we were running short of time. Look at their website, if that doesn't grab you then perhaps this place is not for you, but for us, a couple of 50 somethings in Rome for the first time, we couldn't have chosen better.

Reviews.Title: “The full scoop on Barrett”
Reviews.Author: KLoveToronto
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I concur the praise below - this is a terrific business with over-the-top customer service. And dollar-for-dollar, possibly the best lodging value in Rome. And if you're an experienced European traveler, you know what to expect when you see the word "pensione". But if not, hopefully the following will set your expectations appropriately. Here's what you'll get (and not get) at Pensione Barrett; - You'll get a tiny room. That's typical for urban Europe, and especially for Rome. And by tiny, I mean about 10'x8', crammed with furniture, art, etc. Nowhere to stand really. - The room will be clean and well maintained with (in my case) a VERY firm bed. Sort of a slab of granite really. - Cramped but very complete bathroom, including a bidet and shower massage. Rough, scratchy but ample towels. - Armoir thoughtfully full of hangers, and with a small safe. - A massage chair, foot massager and foot bath. Plus, every little amenity, toiletry, etc you can imagine. - Minibar, plus everything (and I mean everything) you need to make breakfast. One of the nicest surprises - all reasonably priced. My total minibar bill after a week was about 20 Euro, and I used it every morning for breakfast, and sometimes for snacks. - Given the size of the rooms, they have to cram every available surface with the snacks, toaster, etc. I was constantly knocking things on to the floor. - Free if somewhat intermittent wifi. I would definitely stay there again, as all-in-all it was charming and the staff are amazing. But please calibrate your expectations appropriately. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Two nights in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: rakubob
Reviews.Content: Two lovely nights at the Pensione Barrett. The intensely decorated rooms might be described as kitsch, but only in the best, light-heated sense. The desk clerks and owners, (the current owner took over from his grandmother) were helped in the extreme with their books and guides that they loan out during your stay. We were hesitant about the in room breakfast when reading about it, but found the mini fridge full of things that were quite useful and not overpriced and much more convenient than going out for a meal. We had milk and museli each morning and the espresso machine made fabulous coffee! There was wine, beer, cheese, sausage and lots more at prices you would have paid in the grocery. The extra charge for AC was annoying but even with that the total price was very good for the location, charm and cleanliness of the rooms. Be sure to take a cat census in the ruins across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RubyJames
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Pensione Barrett for three nights. Right from the moment we arrived the staff were extremely helpful. During our stay we asked questions of the staff and were provided with very useful answers. They have guide books and books on Rome which you can borrow, and a list of recommended restaurants. When we left the staff ordered us a taxi to the airport which saved us a lot of drama. The triple room was really comfortable, though crammed full of furniture. The bathroom was pretty new and very clean. There are back and foot massagers and a foot spa provided, which is useful for weary tourists. The decor has been described before as 'quirky' and that about sums it up! Someone has spent a lot of time decorating these hotel rooms and they are great. Ours had antique views of Rome on the walls, which was interesting when you'd just visited the same place. Breakfast is provided as a self-service selection of cereals and other goodies all at a reasonable price. There is a coffee maker in the room, too. We found that the breakfast provided was both cheaper and more filling than the typical coffee and croissant you could get in a cafe. The location of Pensione Barrett is superb. If you want public transport it's right there, and if you want to walk to places nothing in central Rome is very far away. The hotel is right on the tram line, which causes some noise but is not a drama really. I'd really recommend this hotel and I'd stay there again on another trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: RidleyNY
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Pensione Barrett during our honeymoon. The hotel is only a few blocks from the Pantheon and the beautiful Piazza della Rotonda. The pensione is a small charming hotel with very friendly and helpful staff and owners. Our room had a selection reasonably priced grab and go snacks if you wanted to start your day quickly. The room was small but standard from my experience with European hotels. There was an in-the-wall A/C unit and a wonderful massage shower. My husband and I are from New York and we are used to walking so the Pensione was a great home base since it was so centrally located. The owners were so very helpful with directions and recommendations on dining. And since they knew it was our honeymoon, they even gave us a little gift when we checked out. The next visit to Rome will include a stay at the Pensione Barrett.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful quirky hotel, plenty of charm, Fantastic Location.”
Reviews.Author: bridene
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Husband are just back from our five day trip to Rome, and what words can i use to describe it only "amazing".We stayed in the Pension Barrett and I have to say this has to be the best hotel/B & B we ever stayed in, its location is fantastic and its hospitality is second to non, any recommendations that the couple gave us for day trips, meals, shopping etc were perfect and that is hospitality is what made our trip so special, our room was small enough but it was beautiful the decor was beautiful and the added touches after a long day walking and sight seeing was such a treat ie: foot massager, back massager and foot spa, would i recommed this hotel absolutely 100%

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting Roman Pensione”
Reviews.Author: Karen V
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Rome for almost 50 years. I have stayed at the finest, some of cheapest, and even rented apartments. Pension Barrett will be the only place I stay or recommend. Ideal location at Largo Argentina. Transportation at your doorstep. Walkable to so many delightful areas: theGhetto, Navonna, Pantheon, Tratevere, campo die Fiori, etc. Warm and helpful owners and staff. They truly love and know Rome and share tips on restaurants, new events, etc. They are art lovers who have packed art into every corner of this delightfully funky pension. There is an espresso machine, chair and foot massage, foo and drink, and refrigerator in each room! The website is exceptionally informative and humorous. Yo will not find a warmer welcome or a more delightful home base in this always glorious city!,

Reviews.Title: “Great quirky B&B/Hotel in Rome Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: BrockStrongo
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and slightly quirky B&B / Hotel in the Trastevere district of Rome. Rooms are nice and a good size (we had a triple room) and are decorated with classical stuccos/sculptures and paintings. There was even foot and back massage equipment in the room which was handy after a lot of walking around during the day. It's very close to the Pantheon and Campo dei Fiori, as well as plenty of great bars and restaurants. Quite easy to get to from the airport as well. The people who run the property are very friendly, go out of the way to be helpful for your stay in Rome and kindly gave us a small leaving present of handmade pasta when we left. No real downsides, though it's the type of place where you have to leave your key at the desk and buzz to get in - there was one occasion during the day where we had to buzz several times and wait a little while to get in. It wasn't a drama for us, though. You need to pay extra for air con which we didn't and it was pretty okay temperature wise with the window open (in mid-September) but it did get a little noisy outside in the morning with a tram turnaround just outside. Overall, a great place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly unique, we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: AriannaKent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our 14 year old daughter. The location could not be better. Invaluable advice from the lovely owners, regarding sightseeing made our trip easy and truly unforgettable. Rome is incredible and easily explored from this hotel. We would definitely stay here again if we should return. Nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with great service and very charming”
Reviews.Author: Coreyuf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a small family owned hotel with grat charm. The room with private bathroom was very nice and clean. The location is perfect close to all the important sites and close to all the great restaurants. Only negative would be the extra charge for a/c. It is on the second floor with no elevator so it is not recommended for people with acessibility issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Leo294074
Reviews.Content: Michele, Cinzia and Alberto really made us feel welcome and cozy. Location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, unique hotel. Like staying with friends.”
Reviews.Author: okiemom
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Pension Barret. It is truly a unique and wonderful hotel. The location is excellent and Michelle and his wife were like staying with friends. They loaned us guide books and helped us plan our sight seeing and find wonderful restaurants. The subway doesn't cover the old parts of Rome so buses are the best option. Michelle and his staff helped us know which one to take and where to get on and off. The decor is over the top in the Baroque and Italian style. Foot and back massagers are a welcome treat. Our room was on the front of the hotel. The buses and trams make quite a bit of noise and some vibration when going by. We paid the 10 euros for air conditioning and kept the windows closed. You could still hear it but it wasn't a problem. If the windows were open it might be too loud. We loved this hotel and felt like we were staying in a luxury apartment!

Reviews.Title: “Unique, comfortable, courteous”
Reviews.Author: Tamaka
Reviews.Content: Pensione Barrett is a wonderful little hotel, and we really enjoyed our stay. One of the hotel's most important assets is its great location in the vicinity of various historical sights and attractions, such as Pantheon, Campo de Fiori, Piazza Venezia and so on. In addition, several buslines and trams provide easy access practically everywhere in the city. The staff is always friendly and willing to provide information on where to eat and what to see. The rooms are furnished with a personal touch, decorated with statues and reliefs, and equipped with a foot spa and a coffee machine, and various other details that add to one's comfort. This is a great alternative to the sterile and faceless hotel chains. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: blackswanofwa
Reviews.Content: After reading so many positive reviews on this place on Tripadvisor, and no mention of bedbugs (!), I decided to book a stay at Pensione Barrett and was not disappointed, in fact, everything in the review was true! From the decor (over the top for some, but hey! this is Rome) to the lovely couple who own/run this place with the greatest passion and pride! Yes, there's a lot of stairs to negotiate but once you ring the bell, Micherle or Richard will be down in a jiffy to carry your luggage for you, so - that's taken care of. Location wise - you couldn't ask for a better one. We arrived at the Trastevere train station after taking a train off our ship at Civitavecchia (easy peasy, thanks to Tripadvisor reviewers!) and took the no 8 tram just outside the station right to the doorstep of the Pensione! I'm not kidding, it's that convenient, as the tram ends here and you'll be asked to get off! We had room 6 (triple share) and the owners have thought of everything - from providing hand wipes for the touring around humid Rome, to back and foot massage equipment which we laughed at initially, but they came in handy after walking around Rome a whole day! Which hotel gives you a thank you and going away present? Pensione Barrett does! How thoughtful! I had wanted to book a hotel near Roma Termini on my return journey, but decided I liked the friendliness, security (24 hr reception) and location of the Pensione Barrett so returned for a last night before my trip home. And I received another present. They are full of information on how to/where to go, restaurant ideas etc and even sell the Roma Card and other passes. Rooms are super clean (I'm not kidding - better than some 5 star hotels I've stayed at!) and all staff are lovely and accommodating. Thank you for a wonderful stay Micherle and Cinzia Sacco!

Reviews.Title: “It felt like I was staying with old friends.”
Reviews.Author: kathryn1951
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent 10 days in Italy and began our vacation in Rome. This little pensione was our first welcome to the Eternal City and we were charmed from the moment we heard a happy "buon giorno" through the intercom. Neat, clean and quaintly cluttered, this little pensione offered the best of Italian hospitality. We were greeted by the engaging owners, Signor and Signora Sacco, whose fluency in several languages eased the transition to a vibrant culture. Our room was small but efficient and clean. The warm and helpful Sacco's made our stay in Rome like seeing an old friend . Perfectly located - we took public transportation from the airport to the front of the pensione - we could walk to nearly any place of interest. The bus to the train station was right in front of our door! Just a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Next time in Rome - we live in pensione barrett.”
Reviews.Author: zviamir98
Reviews.Content: We stayed in pensione barrett on January 5 - June 10, 2011. Reception staffed 24 hours a day by the hotel owners who speak English fluently and other languages . They are very knowledgeable and give accurate information, receive guests warmly and listening to their needs. Rooms are decorated in Italian Renaissance tradition is very clean and comfortable ... Rooms facing the inner courtyard are very quiet. Even with the extra 10 euros for air-condition per night - it is an excellent price. Next time in Rome - we live in pensione barrett.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: cjduggandubai
Reviews.Content: What a fab hotel right in the centre, we had a fabulous time. The host's were amazing and they couldnt do enough for us in relaying information to us and help to plan our short visit. Their assistance was so invaluable and above and beyond anything I have experienced before, a personal touch. The room was amazing, small and quaint - decor fabulous. Comfy bed and foot massage and shower with jets to ease away those tired muscles after being on your feet all day, visiting this amazing city. definetly highly recommend this place, and we shall hopefully return one day. Carolyn and Mike Duggan Dubai

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location with perfect hosts!”
Reviews.Author: nj823kl
Reviews.Content: This pensione was delightful! The owners, Mr. and Mrs. Sacco, are fluent in English (and many other languages) and they performed as full time consierges for the pensione. The pensione is perfectly located. We walked to every site from this location; although the bus and tram run directly in front of the pensione. It is as clean as a whistle and decorated in a quirky fashion, utterly delightful! The downside is having to walk up 2 flights of stairs to get to the pensione but it is good excersize... The Sacco's are the warmest, welcoming "family" you could have away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy with trams under the window.”
Reviews.Author: sharonb04
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel too noisy. The trams right past the window make the ground shake, and aircon is an extra 10euro per day. You have to have aircon because it is very noisy with the window open. Our room was very small. The location is ok but very busy, all through the night. Try to find something quiet in this area closer to the market.

Reviews.Title: “Informative, friendly owners and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Davidlecale
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and the bedroom was very clean and comfortable. Food and drinks were stocked in the bedroom for breakfast and replenished on a daily basis. The owners were very helpful and lent us books on Rome and advised us on the best travel arrangements and sights we should visit. They could not have been more helpful and arranged for tickets to the Vatican Museum. The location was great for buses and trams and close to Campo Del Fiori. If you are arriving from Da Vinci Airport take the train to Trasteverre Station and then tram no 8 to Argentina and this stops right outside the door of the Pensione.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Hitogdit
Reviews.Content: Clean, charming and quirky rooms with all the necessities you might need (the bathroom even had tiny little toothbrushes and toothpaste, just in case:) great value for money, very friendly and helpfull staff who made sure we had a pleasant stay! Highly recommended! Cecilie

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: CicciLanza
Reviews.Content: Don't look for exclusive and expensive in-hotels. Just call Michele and book a room at the "Pensione Barrett". You will find a friendly, clean and very special accommodation. The best I ever had in my more than 20 stays in Rome. Cicci, Lucerne

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: giancarlosales
Reviews.Content: Close to many sights and with great ease of public transportation. A wonderful staff and owners, always ready to help you and provide great tips of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Location, affection, economy”
Reviews.Author: trentonmakes
Reviews.Content: Alright, it's a climb -- two flights up to the floor of this Roman palazzo that houses the pensione, not the best welcome when you're hauling your bags on arrival -- but you find yourself in a warm and affectionate environment when you walk through the door, surrounded (if not suffocated!) by rococo decoration on every side, and attentively served by a caring couple, the owners Michele Sacco and his wife, whose life's mission seems to be ensuring that visitors fall totally in love with Rome. The rooms can be very tight (ours was), but they're like Fiat's new Cinquecento (500): all the essential amenities are squeezed into a very compact space. The price is as good as you will find in Rome. And the location, facing the republican-era ruins of Largo Argentina, is spectacularly central.

Reviews.Title: “For my next travel in Rome i'll visit this hotel again...!”
Reviews.Author: enopainter
Reviews.Content: Very good service,gentile and very friendly people,the owners are a couple of " persone simpaticissime " and the personnel can give you very helpful information about anything ,the room was a piece of art , and include many comforts (massage , jacuzzi etc.), the wiev is beautiful, you can see from your window the place Caesar was killed "et tu Brutus" was heard there...The location is in the center , a very little steps from Piaza Venezia

Reviews.Title: “A super hotel! "When in Rome" stay at Hotel Pensione Barrett”
Reviews.Author: RachK2000
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pensione Barrett was an absolute gem! We have never experienced customer service like it. The staff were personable and always on hand with information, guidebooks and recommendations. Clean and pleasant. The rooms are very quirky and very "Rome" with plenty of clean towels and slippers. A very nice hotel to retreat to after a day exploring beautiful Rome. We stated for 4 days and managed to walk everywhere and avoid public transport so, the location is perfect. "When in Rome"....stay here"

Reviews.Title: “A truely unique hotel - will be a highlight of your holiday in itself!”
Reviews.Author: arekusu22
Reviews.Content: I've never done a review for anything online before, but in this case I've been so moved by the awesomeness of this hotel that I simply have to leave a comment. So, here's what's good about it.... - unbelievably good location, didn't use public transport once... - ridiculously quirky, fun rooms, complete with statues, columns, paintings, foot bath, massage chair... you name it! the lobby is a site to behold too. - mini bar at supermarket prices!!! bet you've never seen that before!! - hands down the most fun hotel website ever, well worth a look. - but best of all.... THE OWNERS!! they're so so friendly and helpful. michele and his wife will go go above and beyond to make sure you get the most out of rome and will make your stay unforgetable.. a very personal service!! what can i say.. if you're in rome, you should stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely people, quirky atmosphere, great value”
Reviews.Author: JPGaul
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty special place. It's in the perfect location, bang in the Centro Storico, with the myriad pleasures that Rome has to offer at your door. The owners and staff were delightfully warm, efficient and respectful. The rooms are very well equipped with all sorts of devices - back massage chair, foot spa, espresso machine, an incredibly well priced mini-bar (water in it was cheaper than buying from a bar or shop). There's a great shower and large, very comfortable beds. I cannot praise this place enough. We had a great stay. At the prices they charge this has to be one of the very best value hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This place is the perfect resting place in the middle of all the great sights of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: VTettelbach
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister, and I recently spent three nights here and absolutely loved it. The pensione is a lovely mix of kitch, with all sorts of art replicas for decor. Each room comes with a massage chair for your back, one for your feet and a place to soak those weary dogs after a day of walking. The best part about the hotel are the owners, they were so kind and helpful, going out of their way to make our trip just right. I would highly recommend staying here, you can walk to everything you want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient location for all attractions with quirky decor and charming friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: coolcus2mer
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is situated in a very central location for all main attractions and tickets for entry and tours can be obtained at reception. Once occupied by Elizabeth Barrett Browning and hence the name. Located on third floor of building and inconspicuous from the street this charming hotel is a gem. Ingredients for a simple breakfast or snacks are provided in the bedroom at small cost. No restaurant but there are many located near by. The decor is quite individual with a lot of artefacts displayed but this adds to the character. Guide books are provided and staff are very helpful in providing information and making guests feel welcome. Individual service is a plus. The foot and back massager in the room are welcome at the end of a long day exploring the treasures of the city.

Reviews.Title: “a unique experience and very helpful management and staff”
Reviews.Author: mmecritique
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Barrett is one of a kind. The interior resembles a museum of paintings and sculptures. Located on the Largo Argentina in Rome, it is within walking distance of many historic attractions and good restaurants. Access to the bus is right outside the door. The management couldn't have been more helpful during our stay. And the price is definitely right, considering its wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Pierre29
Reviews.Content: I've stayed one week at thise pensione. Staff very kind. For friends whospeak french, no problemsr , the host speak very well french, They give us a lost information. By exemple : how to do, wiht metro and buses to Villa d'Este at Tivoli or waht we can see in Rome, exhibithons, church and so long. Very quite place, rooms very kindly, This a place where we must to be.

Reviews.Title: “Being home in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Crisivano
Reviews.Content: The owners are very gentle and friendly and give great advice for visiting interesting "not so famous" touristic sites. The lobby is a small museum in itself and book of arts are available to the clients. The room is small but very clean and super technological including items like electric massage, Jacuzzi shower, everything for a good breakfast and air conditioning. The location is optimal, close to every spot in the very centre of Rome, but also very quiet. The rooms ara a bit overcrowded with baroque furniture. Taking away some decorative items could give more space to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jillyDublin
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here as a first time visitor to Rome. It was perfect for us. The location was so central. We were also just across the river from trastavere! The people in the hotel gave us a list of restaurants which were lovely (& not too touristy!). The place was spotless & the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Quirky decor & massage chairs in the rooms make for a cool stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and different from chain type hotels”
Reviews.Author: daffodil44
Reviews.Content: Possibly expensive, though did not compare with others as a friend recommended. Could have done with a kettle as we like to drink hot water. Coffee and tea made in a machine and charged for. Easy to get to and walking distance to all sites. Very clean and comfortable. Room delightfully and unusually decorated. Good English spoken and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in a surprising baroque hotel”
Reviews.Author: wahatie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for the 2011 New Year's weekend. Although a little bit kitschy, the decoration of the hotel matches perfectly with the splendors of Rome. Certainly, we had never seen such a decoration in any hotel before... Rooms are very clean and comfortable. The beds are OK (not fantastic, that's the only minor remark on the quality of the hotel). Location is fantastic, we did discover most of Rome just walking around or using the busses (with the fantastic Roma pass). But what makes this hotel really unforgettable is the hospitality and warm welcome. No exception, the entire staff excels in hospitality and helpfulness. And the fact that everybody gets a touristic guide on Rome, brilliant idea. We certainly would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't find a better location”
Reviews.Author: canada1969
Reviews.Content: Has a beautiful entrance, clean and sunny rooms. The owner is friendly, helpful and speaks English

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KarinaSch
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice is the very speciel interior. Statues, relief, painting, flowers, colors everywhere. Very speciel and charming. We were here with family and had 3 rooms - all different, but also alike. Very good cleaning. The staff is very friendly, helpfull and smiles all the time. Location is good - lots to see in walking distance, and restaurants nearby (get some tips from the staff) No elevators - you have to carry your bags to 2. second floor. Wireless internet worked only in the lobby. We stayed 2 adults and 2 childern (13 & 16) in a 3-person room with 1 normal bed and a double bed where 3 of us slept. It costed 10 euro extra for the extra person. We would defintly stay here again next time we come to Rome - this is a hotel not like any else we have seen.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal base for exploring Rome's glorious past”
Reviews.Author: ericsOxford
Reviews.Content: Our first contact via the website, which is hilarious, set the tone for our visit The owners and staff could not have been more helpful. Guidebooks and lists of recommended restaurants were provided The location is perfect for those of us who prefer to walk to view the sights The rooms are striking if a little cramped with all the extras provided, such as massage chair, trouser press, microwave and coffee machine for do-it-yourself breakfast. The rooms, overlooking the sacred site and cat sanctuary, were a little noisy with the windows open but quiet when the shutters and windows were closed. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom efficient. We would certainly go again and recommend our friends to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable place I've stayed in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CondorDomino
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Pensione Barratt for 1 Friday night in September 2010. I returned because I had a very positive experience staying their around 8 year ago. I can confirm the same high standards remain. We were given personal accurate e-mail advice on how to get to the hotel. We were personally greated and shown our rooms - and given great advice on where to go and eat.. I stayed in room 12 which, as before, was spotlessly clean, and comfortable - and full of more gadgets than I could use. The style is interesting and eclectic. The location is perfect - a short walk from The Pantheon and Campo di Fiori. A comfortable walk to the Vatican or Colisseum. Great value for money. This is where I will return when coming back to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great location, warm approach and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: zecorb
Reviews.Content: We truly recommend the very well located Pensione Barrett. The major sights in the city are literally in walking distance. We also appreciated the warm welcome of the hotel owners. It is like staying with friends whilst a professional distance is kept.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Koben
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pensione Barrett, at Piazza Argentina. Its easy to reach with the train from the airport to Trastevere station and then tram no 8 to its final destination. The Pensione is on the third floor without a lift, but when you come in its a world of its own. Every room is lavishly decorated. We had 19 angels, two sculptures, and a painted relief of Michelangelo in our room! We also had a massage chair, a foot massage, an espresso machine, a bread warmer as well as fridge full of breakfast items. There is no breakfast room but you get free, fresh croissants every day and pay a small fee for the other breakfast items. The room is very clean and the bed is good. The management speaks good English and helps you in any way they can. Alberto lent us books about the Secret Rome. The Pensione Barrett is close to the Pantheon, piazza Navone etc. Everything outside your doorstep! We highly recommend this place. Nina and Bjorn from Oslo, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value/location/friendliness”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSvvimmer
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I spent 4 nights at this pensione, and concur with all the positive comments by other reviewers (in fact, we decided to book it after reading TripAdvisor). We wanted a reasonably priced and quiet place in the Centro Storico, and Barrett fit the bill perfectly. We were given room 14, which faces an inner courtyard and is therefore very quiet, both day (for the pennichella) and night (for an extended sleep). In addition to the queen bed, the room has also a single bed, which gave us extra space to spread out our things. Though Torre Argentina is a hub of public transportation, we preferred to walk to the great many landmarks that are just minutes away on foot (Piazza Navona, Campo de' Fiori, Pantheon, the Tosca Places, Piazza Venezia, the Campidoglio, Santa Maria in Cosmedin, Isola Tiberina, Trastevere - you name them. The bed and shower were quite comfortable, the room was squeaky clean, and the personnel extremely helpful even without our asking. True, the building has no elevator (this is due to a city ordnance forbidding the construction of elevator shafts in historical buildings such as this one), the decor of the rooms (which we found amusing) may be a bit too kitch for the taste of some. But, at 130 Euros per night, I defy you to find a better place in the Centro in terms of price/quality. We highly recommend it to folks who aren't overly finicky and come here to enjoy the city and use the room just for showering and sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Pensione Barrett, Rome”
Reviews.Author: BFava
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, and we could not have been any happier. The people that work there are THE NICEST EVER! They have thought of everything.. slippers a foot bath (great after a day of walking like crazy) a jacuzzi back massaging shower, and very nicely decorated rooms. There is an espresso machine and lots of snacks and drinks in the room that are very reasonably priced. This hotel is also in the BEST location ever. It was a ten minute walk to the Colosseum, four blocks away from the Pantheon and has Campo dei Fiori right behind it (best Piazza ever) it is also five minutes away from Trastevere, the best area in Rome. In front of the hotel are some ruins, where Ceasar was killed!!! We loved everything about staying here, and will stay there again, the owners and staff are the NICEST most HELPFUL people ever!

Reviews.Title: “Never Lost at the Pensione Barrett”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMcLondon
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Rome, I was nervous, so much information to sift through, then you get to Rome. Wow! the city is so beautiful. The propeitors and staff at the Pensione Barrett, give really good advice and are extremely patient. The Room was small, however you soon acclimatised. We had a room facing an internal courtyard with only another room as a neighbour and did not experience any of the problems experienced by previous guests. All in all - a very clean establishment with caring staff.

HotelInfo.Name: Pensione Barrett
HotelInfo.Address: Via Di Torre Argentina, 47, 00186 Rome, Italy
